doc.title: Jefferies
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Key Takeaways from Group Investor CallKey Takeaways from Group Investor Call_2025-08-29

passages.text: China (PRC) | Internet Trip.com

Highlights include (1) TCOM empowers suppliers and travelers with AI enhancing performance and experience. In addition, AI improves cost efficiencies and productivity for TCOM; (2) One- stop travel platform focuses on excellent service rather than low price. Value creation is key; (3) market share gain story in accommodation with further room to grow in online penetration; (4) inbound travel is in early stage with potential; (5) committed to shareholder returns.

AI empowerment in multiple fronts. TCOM launched AI tools which empower (a) large hotel partners tapping into inbound travel market; (b) small and low stars hotels can better serve international travelers with multi- lingual customer services. In addition, hotel partners can benefit from advice on improving business performance; (c) AI content generation drives better conversion (e.g. video generation); (d) hotel partners offer better value- added services with increasing average spending per traveler (e.g. spa, buffet). Different from general- purpose AI, TCOM leverages its huge in- house datasets and provides travelers with customized, real- time and authentic recommendations (e.g. travel itinerary). On the other hand, TCOM benefits from cost efficiencies and higher productivity with AI. On S&M, AI enables precision in marketing spending with better ROI and shorter time is taken in preparation of marketing material.

One- stop travel platform with excellent services makes the difference. TCOM considers good service is key instead of low price. It has close supplier relationships and creates value backed by solid execution. On the other hand, OTA is different from third party apps providing direct air ticketing service. TCOM provides travelers with one- stop travel offerings with good services as well as comprehensive product selections. This is important for leisure travelers who get better value through OTA. TCOM continues to gain market share and sees limited impact from competition. There is further room to grow in online hotel penetration.

Inbound travel is in early stages with potential. Inbound travel sector is in early stages with huge room to grow in terms of % of GDP vs developed markets. TCOM experienced triple- digit volume growth for inbound. Inbound travel is profitable on higher hotel ADR and revenue per air ticket for cross border travel. For outbound travel, TCOM has outpaced industry growth, surpassing 2019 levels, but Hotel and air ticketing. Volume maintains solid growth pace. For Trip.com, it is undergoing fast growth in international hotels and air- ticketing. It pursues ROI focused approach in third and performance based marketing. By geography, APAC comes first, followed by EMEA and rest of the world.

Committed to shareholder returns. TCOM's new share buyback program of USD5bn reflects long- term commitment to shareholders and is funded by disposal of its stake in MakeMyTrip and its own cash. The goal is to reduce share count annually and offset ESOP dilutions. TCOM view organic growth as key vs large- scale M&A activities.

We would like to thank Fiona Fan, employee of Evaluerserve Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report. We would like to thank Han Wang, employee of Evaluerserve Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report We would like to thank Erica Qiu, employee of Evaluerserve Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report.

Trip.comTrip.com Group Ltd. provides online travel agency services. The company offers mobile applications, hotel reservations, flight ticketing, package tours, corporate travel management, and train ticketing services.

We have a Buy rating and DCF- based PT of USD85/HKD659. Key risks include (1) prolonged macro headwinds lead to weaker- than- expected outlook; (2) higher- than- expected marketing spend on hotel segment in lower- tier cities; and (3) intense competition overseas with global players.

Our price target for Makemytrip of US\\$33.8/share is based on DCF and implies \(3.7x\) EV to FY21E net revenue. Key risks: \(1>\) Weaker growth in air ticketing and hotel booking, \(2>\) Higher competitive intensity and cash burn. \(3>\) Corporate action.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.

NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations. Monitor - Describes securities whose companies and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
